Exodus is a tool for painless relocation of Linux ELF binaries. It bundles all dependencies, creates a statically linked wrapper, and installs the package on the target machine, enabling software to run on systems where it might otherwise be unavailable due to missing packages or outdated distributions.

The network-debug repository provides a CLI tool for diagnosing, benchmarking, and optimizing Linux networking. It offers features such as comprehensive network diagnosis, safety-first design with dry-run and rollback capabilities, and cross-distribution support. The tool is designed for developers, system administrators, and power users to optimize network performance with safety and flexibility.
